text: Günter Guillaume (1 February 1927 - 10 April 1995) was a German spy. His job was to get information as an agent for East Germany's secret service, the Stasi, in West Germany. Guillaume became West German chancellor Willy Brandt's secretary, and his discovery as a spy in 1973 led to Brandt's resignation as chancellor in what became known as the Guillaume affair. ==References== Category:1927 births Category:1995 deaths Category:Deaths from kidney cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Germany Category:East German people Category:German criminals Category:Nazi Party Category:Politicians from Berlin Category:Spies Category:Stasi people
title: Günter Guillaume
